> Hello everyone,

I just noticed that we have this PR in the spec repo that is super interesting: https://github.com/leanEthereum/leanSpec/pull/36

It's about integrating the primitives for rainbow staking and this is super good to have this early in the process of the spec like that we get a head start. But this will require some discussions to make this properly as we never touched this topic in the discussion.

Everyone, the rainbow staking PR is opened as draft, with the intent to be, as stated, a discussion starter. However, we also find this to be a good occasion to set the foundation for integrating the Validator-to-Staker paradigm change, and the delegation primitives, into lean consensus. 

Reiterating what @tcoratger wrote above, we strongly believe that it would be of value to identify which delegation / rainbow staking parts can be defined early in the lean consensus specification process, get them merged and set the stage for future developments (even if it's only types or terminology or design decisions in some parts)

This being said, I welcome comments on the existing PR, so we can advance towards something concrete
